title: 2000 - Lemmy, Slim Jim and Danny B. FLAC
description:
Lemmy, Slim Jim and Danny B. - 2000 - Lemmy, Slim Jim and Danny B.

If you're lookin' for Motorhead's version of the 50's, this ain't it! If you want to hear today's rockers playing the songs that formed rock'n'roll the way they were originally played - here ye go!
A lifelong lover of rock Ã¢â‚¬ËœnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ roll, MotÃƒÂ¶rheadÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Lemmy Kilmister recorded this album of old rockabilly and honky-tonk classics at the turn of the century with Stray Cats drummer Slim Jim Phantom and guitarist Danny B. Harvey of Lonesome Spurs and The Rockats. (At first they used the moniker Lemmy, Slim Jim, & Danny B, which they changed to The Head Cat with their 2006 sophomore album.) None of these tunes will melt off your face like Ã¢â‚¬Å“Silver MachineÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ or Ã¢â‚¬Å“Ace of Spades,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ but the fun the trio had recording them is palpable, starting with a true-to-form cover of Johnny CashÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Ã¢â‚¬Å“Big River.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ Over the simple boom-bap-boom of Slim JimÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s snare-and-kick-drum combo, Danny B squeezes out classic-toned leads while Lemmy strums an acoustic guitar and croons like Cash through swampy layers of reverb. He returns to the raspy-throated roughneck we all know and love on a bouncy rendition of Lloyd PriceÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Ã¢â‚¬Å“Lawdy Miss ClawdyÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ before revealing a love for all things Buddy Holly with endearing takes on Ã¢â‚¬Å“Peggy Sue Got MarriedÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ and Ã¢â‚¬Å“Learning the Game.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½
